experience: You and Jordan both know Abe Pralle, Christopher Stark, and 23 others
You both studied at Northern Arizona University
You both studied at Northern Arizona University from 2007 to 2010

- Solely responsible for ongoing UX design of two major online learning platforms- Created wireframes, information architecture, and full fidelity mock ups for three online learning platforms from conception to release- Documents reusable design patterns and project files for more efficient team workflow- Plans and executes monthly in-person usability studies- Documents design patterns team style guide on WordPress- Creates interactive usability prototypes using HTML/CSS/JS and Axure- Communicates with stake holders to translate requirements into good design
I wrote features and reviews pertaining to video games.

As a student worker at NAU’s Information Technology Services Department, I was in charge of ghosting new machines to be used by faculty and other student workers. I also assisted the full-time PC Support employees with tasks like computer hardware repair and troubleshooting.
NAU Chapter of ACM (Association for Computing Machinery)
I studied computer science for a year before changing my focus to graphic and web design.
recommendations: VP of Design and User Experience at K12

I hired Jordan from Northern Arizona University on the recommendation of one of my former professors. I was not disappointed. Jordan is an extremely capable UX professional who has experience with wireframes, visual design, usability testing and coding his own prototypes. His attitude and communication style make him easy to work with. He’s dependable, thoughtful, and proactive in every project and task he’s given. If Jordan doesn’t know how to achieve something he will find a way and figure it out. Jordan is continually concerned for the user and ensuring the choices he and teammates make support their needs. Managing him for 3 years was one of my biggest joys as a manager. Jordan has tremendous potential and takes every opportunity seriously.

March 24, 2017, Jennifer worked with Jordan in different groups

I've worked closely with Jordan over the past few years on our company's flagship K12 LMS product. Jordan has a great blend of UX expertise, technical skills, and passion for our users and their journeys.  I  always rely on Jordan's guidance as we develop new features as he makes user-centric decisions grounded on best practices and data. His easy going collaborative style makes him a well respected leader as he is able to articulate and advocate for user needs in a manner that is well received by our cross functional teams. He is always eager and willing to assist in efforts to ensure our users have the best interactions possible with our products.  I highly recommend Jordan!

March 9, 2017, Jordan worked with Anika in the same group

Jordan has been a great UX designer/teammate/teacher in my first year at Pearson.He quickly adapts to each new design and prototyping tool our team tries, like Sketch, Axure, Zeplin, and our UX style guide. And he is great at helping other teammates learn them too, for example he took time out of his schedule to spend a few hours introducing me to Axure.Jordan frequently communicates across disciplines, leading meetings with product owners, developers, and other stakeholders. I admire how he is always respectful of everyone’s roles and input, and is especially good at communicating and advocating for our users’ needs to these groups.His love of gaming and toys brings some fun to the office as well!Any team would be lucky to have Jordan.

March 1, 2017, Jordan worked with Dayne in the same group

Jordan is one of those people whom I love working with. Jordan is focused, results-driven, and a very talented UX Designer. He always fights for the user and is sure to make metrics informed decisions on any designs he creates. His user journeys are very well thought out and created with attention to detail. As far as working with Jordan on a day to day basis I can't say enough good things. Jordan works very well with anyone, no matter level, title, or disposition. Jordan knows how to speak and guide developers to a final vison for a design and can incorporate feedback flawlessly. Jordan is also amazing at thinking of the angles and edge cases that comes with creating a wonderful user experience that delights and is tailored to individual users. Jordan is a knowledgable and wonderful addition to any team and if I could always work with him in any job I went to I would.

February 15, 2017, Tim worked with Jordan in different groups

For more than 4.5 years working with Jordan, I have witnessed how he has developed into a skilled designer and problem-solver. He started off with a strong foundation in design and has continually improved in that area by learning new skills, software, and prototyping tools. Additionally, he has learned to code, which has elevated his prototyping skills to a serious professional level.  In addition to designing and developing, Jordan has improved his interpersonal skills to engage in the problem-solving process and effectively communicate his ideas with colleagues, managers, and executives. He collaborates effectively and is an excellent teammate. Jordan is committed to the providing superior user experiences, mainly by adhering to established best practices in design, as well as championing UX Research to inform the iterative design process. My team and I have conducted nearly a hundred UX research activities with the products for which Jordan is responsible. Jordan is so adept with UX Research methodologies that the study design planning is expedited when he participates. Jordan values seeing how users interact with the designs because he is able to recognize the trends where the design could be improve and starts generating solutions before all the sessions are completed. Furthermore, Jordan is a valued member of his team as well as extended product and research teams within the organization. In addition to being a consummate professional, Jordan is personable in an understated way and has an excellent sense of humor. Jordan is a tremendous asset to our organization. I thoroughly enjoy working with him and immensely respect his work.

Over the past several years, I have had the opportunity to both work along side Jordan and help him shape his career. It is rare that you come across a standout talent who is also a pleasure to work with. One of Jordan’s qualities that I admire is his ability to establish strong collaborative relationships with cross-discipline teams, such as product management, architecture and development. These relationships provide Jordan with a solid foundation that supports his ability to take a feature from initial concept, carry it through the entire design process and deliver a solid solution that not only meets the original request, but also illuminates and delivers upon what the stakeholder really needs. Jordan has become an indispensable part of my team at Pearson and would be an asset to any team.

May 2, 2017, Anika worked with Jordan in the same group

Anika is the detailed oriented, user-centric designer that every team needs. I worked with her for over a year at Pearson and can't recommend her enough.Whether it's addressing accessibility concerns or planning usability studies, she's always thinking of who her projects are for and what they need. She also has a strong visual design background that greatly benefits our band of unicorns at Pearson.She's more than capable of handling her own projects or collaborating with a team. On top of all that, she's a complete joy to work with. No design team is complete without someone like Anika.

April 18, 2017, Jordan worked with Jennifer in different groups

Jenn is one of the best product managers I've worked with in my five years at Pearson. She always becomes an expert on whatever project is being worked on and is especially conscious of the UX team's efforts. Whether a development question needs to be clarified or requirements change, she always knows who to talk to and keeps everyone on task with the original product goals in mind.She's also just a joy to be around. I can't remember a meeting with her that didn't include delicious pastries or jelly beans. Any project would greatly benefit from Jenn's leadership skills and expertise.
